greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Powers of 2 written backwards.
comment: Freeman Dyson believes that A014963(a(n))<>5 is true but cannot be proved, see link. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 05 2005
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Richard Lipton, More on testing Dyson's conjecture (2014)
N. J. A. Sloane, Exciting Number Sequences (video of talk), Mar 05 2021.
xref: The following are parallel families: A000079 (2^n), A004094 (2^n reversed), A028909 (2^n sorted up), A028910 (2^n sorted down), A036447 (double and reverse), A057615 (double and sort up), A263451 (double and sort down); A000244 (3^n), A004167 (3^n reversed), A321540 (3^n sorted up), A321539 (3^n sorted down), A163632 (triple and reverse), A321542 (triple and sort up), A321541 (triple and sort down).
For indices of primes see A057708.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
